title: Oskar Lafontaine and the troubled German Left
snippet: Die Linke was formed when the Party of Democratic Socialism, a reformed child of the old ruling party in the German Democratic Republic, known best for its witty, mercurial leader Gregor Gysi, joined three years ago with a new West German party, ...

title: Oskar Lafontaine leaves the Left Party - World Socialist Web Site
snippet: Twenty-three years ago, Lafontaine ... as a Bundestag (federal parliament) deputy with immediate effect. In 2007, together with Gregor Gysi, he founded the Left Party, which he led for three years....

title: Oskar Lafontaine - politician, thought leader & advocate of social justice
snippet: From 2005 to 2009, Lafontaine was parliamentary group leader of the Left Party in the German Bundestag together with Gregor Gysi. From June 16, 2007 to May 15, 2010, he was party chairman of the newly formed DIE LINKE party alongside Lothar Bisky.

title: A Better Europe is Possible
